switches.title: Color
switches.text: Determines if the output will be displayed in color or not. Default is TRUE. Note that regardless of this setting, when one of the '--dump-*' options is specified output will not be in color. No color codes will be saved to the logfile either.

switches.title: Dump
switches.text: Dumps a CSV file of each directory and its associated git remote URL to the console, and to the logfile if that is enabled.

switches.title: Prune
switches.text: Used in conjunction with the --dump option to remove the first <integer> directory levels from the output. This will enable it to be imported back into a different directory structure.

switches.title: Log
switches.text: Copies all script output to a logfile as well as STDOUT. The default logfile name is 'updaterepo.log' in the current users home directory. The previous log will be overwritten, but see the next option.

switches.title: Timestamp
switches.text: Used in conjunction with the --log option to rename the logfile with an added timestamp, thus not overwriting older logs

switches.title: Log Local
switches.text: Store the logfile (if this is enabled) in the current working directory instead of the Users' Home directory

switches.title: Verbose
switches.text: Display all raw Git output plus repository URL and location instead of the reduced output in the default mode. Note that the short-form command is the UPERCASE 'V' not lower!

switches.title: Verbose Errors
switches.text: List all the error output from a failing command in the summary, not just the first line

switches.title: Brief Output
switches.text: Do not print the Header, Footer or Summary.

switches.title: Quiet
switches.text: No output will be displayed to screen during the running of script, except for any fatal errors.

switches.title: Dump Remotes
switches.text: Dumps a bare list to the console of all the Git remote URL's found in the specified directories. This can be saved by redirecting to file or using the --log option.

switches.title: Version
switches.text: Displays the current version number then terminates. All other options will be ignored.

switches.title: Help
switches.text: Displays a brief help text listing syntax and availiable switches then terminates. All other options will be ignored.
